sentences.en: An increase in jobs points to an upturn in the economy.
sentences.cn: 就业增加表明经济好转.

sentences.en: An upturn in the sales figures delighted our manager.
sentences.cn: 销售额的增长使我们的经理很高兴.

sentences.en: Experts have forecast an upturn in the stock market.
sentences.cn: 专家已预测股票市场价格有上升趋势.

sentences.en: Her luck seems to have taken an upturn / to be on the upturn.
In all probability, the final upturn in their fortunes is some months away yet.
sentences.cn: 很可能再过数月他们才会转运。

sentences.en: Strong cyclical upturn of the industry, it is the best investment opportunity.
sentences.cn: 强周期性行业好转之时, 是最佳投资时机.

sentences.en: The economy is experiencing an upturn.
The Treasury has long been predicting an upturn in consumer spending.
sentences.cn: 财政部早就预测消费者支出会出现上扬。

sentences.en: There are some signs that the economy is on the upturn.
sentences.cn: 有些迹象表明经济会好转.

sentences.en: There has been a modest upturn in most parts of the industry.
sentences.cn: 该行业的绝大部分领域都出现了一定程度的好转。

sentences.en: They do not expect an upturn in the economy until the end of the year.
sentences.cn: 他们预测要到年底经济才能有所好转。

sentences.en: This is the strongest upturn for more than 30 years.
sentences.cn: 这是30多年以来最为强劲的好转.

sentences.en: Unlike previous post - war cycles, any upturn will follow a global financial crisis.
sentences.cn: 不像战后的几个周期, 任何一次好转都会伴随着一场金融危机.

sentences.en: With an upturn in the economy, share prices will improve.
sentences.cn: 随着经济的好转, 股价将会上升.

words.tran_cn: 朝上的；向上翘的；翻过来的

trans.tran_en: an increase in the level of something, especially in business activity
